instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message: Hi guys this time I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with no water damage or corrosion, checking all rails I found a <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> pulsing with oscilloscope, which means I possibly have a short on S0. in the schematic I only see a few mentioned where I should start

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
Probably more power rails pulsing.
Should find the one which not and check for short there.

Steady <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS stable

L8710, L8760, L9360, L9330 no pulsing

rest of big coils pulsing normally

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
Post resistance to ground on mentioned coils.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulses too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message: Didn 't hear about GPU disable for this board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message: Could work the same as 3332 since they have the same eDP muxing circuit (and same GPU VCore regulator to disable GPU power).
